Some monitor a single settlement or county, protecting, nourishing, or even vindictively destroying it. Each one has their own sets of interests. Many are vain or petty. Even more change attitudes just as quickly as the winds they guide. Pleasing an anemoi isn't a matter of following a set formula, but rather repeatedly changing course to give them what they desire for their mercurial current interests or perceived needs.

The Shape Of The Air

Anemoi on the Plane of Air are typically genderless, while those who spend time in the Universe sometimes experiment with or develop preferences for one of the genders of the mortals they watch or live close to.

Truespeech.name: Truespeech
Truespeech.description: An anemos can speak with and understand any creature that has a language.

Wind Orchestra.name: Wind Orchestra
Wind Orchestra.description: An anemos does not require instruments to perform music, instead using their winds to create and carry the sounds of any instruments they wish to duplicate. They can mimic any number of instruments simultaneously, creating and directing their own personal orchestra.

Blessed by the Winds.name: Blessed by the Winds
Blessed by the Winds.description: 80 feet. The winds grow turbulent for those who would dare to fly in the same space as an anemos, but they take care to never harm or inconvenience their shepherd. Air within the emanation is difficult terrain for Flying creatures that do not have the air trait. While the aura is active, the anemos cannot be affected by environmental air or weather affects unless they choose to be.

Earthbane.name: Earthbane
Earthbane.description: An anemos's regeneration is suppressed for 1 round if the anemos is affected by an earth effect, or for as long as they are in contact with the ground and 1 round thereafter. If an anemos is submerged in at least 1 inch of mud, dirt, or stone, the anemos's aura deactivates, and the anemos becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Redirect Weather.name: Redirect Weather
Redirect Weather.description:
Requirements The anemos's aura is active

Trigger A creature within the anemos's aura uses an air or electricity spell, or an air or electricity spell otherwise comes into effect within the anemos's aura

Effect The winds and weather of the spell obey the anemos's call. The anemos makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, or other effects of the spell, as though they were the caster.

Collect Thunder.name: Collect Thunder
Collect Thunder.description:
Requirements The anemos has a hand free

Effect The anemos runs a hand through the winds that swirl around them, the sparks from their fingertips coalescing into a thunderbolt. The anemos creates a thunderbolt in their open hand. If the anemos spends an action to Collect Thunder, a bolt instead strikes their open hand, creating a booming peal that deafens all creatures within 20 feet for 1 round unless they succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40] save; this adds the auditory trait to Collect Thunder. Any thunderbolts dissipate after 1 round.

Command the Breeze.name: Command the Breeze
Command the Breeze.description: When an anemos casts a ritual, they perform all aspects of the ritual themself, commanding their winds to complete all the ritual's components. They must fulfill any requirements for the ritual's additional casters and must attempt the checks normally performed by additional casters. In addition, anemoi can cast rituals faster than usual. If a ritual has a casting time measured in days, they can cast it in an equal number of hours.

Storm Strikes Twice.name: Storm Strikes Twice
Storm Strikes Twice.description: The anemos throws a thunderbolt, then becomes a wind that carries them in an instant to the bolt's location to attack again. They make a ranged thunderbolt Strike against a creature within their first range increment, teleport to the creature's location as a gust of wind, then grasp the thrown thunderbolt and make a melee thunderbolt Strike against a creature within reach. Their multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until they've made both attacks.

Nightwood Guardian.name: Nightwood Guardian
Nightwood Guardian.publicNotes: The nightwoods are parts of the Plane of Wood permanently bathed in darkness due to an absence of fluorescent plants. Here, the flora and fauna require darkness, not light, to thrive. Troll-like creatures known as nightwood guardians patrol these woods to ensure they remain in perpetual shadow. Considering themselves righteous gardens, they care little for the excuses of anyone else—intruders or residents. The guardians absolutely loathe the light, though it doesn't harm them as it does some varieties of creatures. Though wary of both light and any interloping lifeforms in their natural habitat, a nightwood guardian's fear turns easily to wrath, making the guardian a force of fury who seeks to drive out intruders.

Fire-fueled Rage.name: Fire-fueled Rage
Fire-fueled Rage.description:
When a nightwood guardian takes fire damage, they become enraged. The guardian gains 15 temporary Hit Points, deals 2 additional damage with melee Strikes, and has a –1 penalty to AC. They can't Raise their Shield or use actions with the concentrate trait except for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}. This effect ends when the nightwood guardian no longer observes any fire for 1 round or when they fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, whichever comes first.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Flesh of Wood.name: Flesh of Wood
Flesh of Wood.description: Wounds inflicted on a nightwood guardian turn their flesh to wood. When the guardian is reduced to 40 HP or fewer, their body becomes solid wood. They are stunned, have resistance 10 to all damage, and have regeneration 40 (deactivated by fire). This ends once the guardian has 100 HP or more, though they can choose to stay in this form indefinitely.

Shield Eyes.name: Shield Eyes
Shield Eyes.description: When a nightwood guardian has their shield raised, they protect their eyes, losing the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} conditions from light blindness and other light effects.

Nightwood Roar.name: Nightwood Roar
Nightwood Roar.description:
Frequency once per hour;

Effect The guardian roars, snuffing out lights in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Ordinary flames and lights are extinguished, and the guardian attempts to counteract any magical light with a [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21} counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 5.

Mauler.name: 斗殴者 Mauler
Mauler.description: 彩绘雄鹿对被擒抱的生物，伤害骰有+5环境加值。

Painted Dance.name: 彩绘舞蹈 Painted Dance
Painted Dance.description:
雄鹿摇晃着身体上的木板，发出刺耳的咔嗒声，彩绘图案随之起舞。在彩绘雄鹿周围60范围内所有能看到或听到彩绘雄鹿的生物必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:28]豁免；因彩绘雄鹿@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}的生物的在豁免上有-4环境减值。无论其豁免结果如何，每个生物临时免疫1小时。

大成功 生物不受影响

成功 生物被彩绘雄鹿@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}1轮。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}并且在震慑期间被彩绘雄鹿迷魂。

大失败 类似失败，但是@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 4}。

Asp of Grief.name: Asp of Grief
Asp of Grief.publicNotes:
On the Plane of Metal, a soft whisper and gentle jingle often accompany the tempestuous winds, while what appear to be gold ribbons twist and writhe through the air. In actuality, these are asps of grief—intelligent, snakelike creatures drawn to strong emotions. The iron irises of their eyes allow them to see the ever-shifting magnetic fields of the Plane of Metal, which the asps can use to sail across the skies.

Asps of grief prey on sorrow and heartache, and times of loss, mourning, and bereavement attract them. Wearing delicate iron bells to announce their arrivals at funerals, battlefields, and the traditional columbaria built for the plane's dead, asps of grief shake their heads, making their bells chime and alerting mourners to their presence. "Will you share your sorrow with me?" they ask, their gentle voices low and sibilant.

If the bereaved agrees, the asps' tongues flick out, tasting the anguish of the living, sipping on sadness and fear, and providing a temporary reprieve from suffering. Though the asps are associated with death, most denizens of the Plane of Metal see them as good omens.

Intensely curious creatures, asps of grief crave information about magic and the multiverse. They might attach themselves to adventuring parties or ask wanderers they meet for any obscure arcane knowledge they may have come across on their journeys. In exchange, the asps of grief offer to help these travelers work through any anguish or trauma they may be carrying— or at least ease their emotional pain for a time.

Calling The Asps

In the Plane of Metal, funeral rites often include placing the deceased upon tall towers surrounded by dishes of water. Chunks of sodium, a silvery-white alkali metal, dance across the surface of the water and catch fire, sending plumes of hydrogen gas into the air. As the asps of grief skate upon the magnetic fields, they can sense this announcement of death and sorrow and follow the trail back to the mourners.

Magnetic Vision.name: Magnetic Vision
Magnetic Vision.description: An asp of grief can see magnetic fields, allowing it to detect large sources of magnetic metal (Bulk 1 or greater) as a precise sense.

Curtain of Calm.name: Curtain of Calm
Curtain of Calm.description: 20 feet. The asp of grief consumes the emotions of the creatures around it. An enemy that begins its turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save. If it fails, the asp consumes its grief. The creature feels a lack of feelings and motivation, reducing its frightened value by 1 and becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to curtain of calm for 1 minute. The asp becomes charged with grief (see iron grief) for 1 minute whenever a creature fails this saving throw.

Iron Grief.name: Iron Grief
Iron Grief.description: If the asp casts magnetic acceleration while charged with grief, it can either heighten the spell to 5th rank or target up to three creatures instead of one, rolling separately against each. After casting the spell, the asp is no longer charged with grief.

Magnetic Traveler.name: Magnetic Traveler
Magnetic Traveler.description: An asp can ride magnetic fields to travel long distances. In a location with strong magnetic fields (including the Plane of Metal and Golarion), its travel Speed is doubled if it's flying.

Crysmal.name: Crysmal
Crysmal.publicNotes:
Crysmals dwell within deep caverns of the Plane of Earth, laden with crystals that glow under their own internal energy. A crysmal's hunger for gems will lead it to travel almost anywhere, even through planar tears. Occasionally, they even establish colonies on planes other than their own, should their newfound territory prove filled with crystals.

A crysmal's scorpion-like body glitters with crystal. As light refracts between the facets, they concentrate and absorb it, energizing the crysmal and, some say, fueling the creature's magic.

Crysmals form small communities in locations where crystals are plentiful, working alongside one another to track down anything from a common quartz to precious rubies and sapphires. Scouting parties use their innate magic to communicate with each other via light and wordless sound, as well as to seek out more crystals. However, when precious stone resources grow scarce, crysmals become independent and territorial about their supply, taking crystals from wherever they can, even seizing them from other creatures.

A crysmal's drive to gather crystals is akin to the drive to reproduce. As a crysmal gathers stones, it stores them within its body. Once the crysmal has enough stored material, the parent fuses its stores into a tiny replica of itself and extrudes the infant crysmal, sometimes referred to as a shardling, into the world. The process leaves the parent weakened for a short time, until it can gather enough crystal to repair its body and begin the process anew. Infant crysmals consume crystals in a similar way. They process the raw material over a few months to grow to adult size. Thereafter, a crysmal "eats" stone only to heal injuries.

Internal Gems

When a crysmal dies, its body breaks into fragments of crystal. Some of these pieces are valuable, but potentially more lucrative are the gems the crysmal has stored inside its body to produce offspring. It takes semiprecious and precious stones worth 500 gp to produce an infant crysmal, though most slain crysmals have only a fraction of this amount stored. Once the stones become a new crysmal, they transform into the crystal of the infant's body, no longer the treasured material they once were.

Crystal Scent.name: Crystal Scent
Crystal Scent.description: A crysmal can sense crystals or gems within 60 feet as if using the scent ability.

Rock Stride.name: Rock Stride
Rock Stride.description: The crysmal phases into adjacent rock that is large enough to accommodate it. Then, the crysmal senses similar or larger rocks within 60 feet and emerges from one. The crysmal can't use this ability again for 1 minute.

Sink into Stone.name: Sink into Stone
Sink into Stone.description: The spikes fired from a crysmal's tail phase into stone, pinning enemies in place. Enemies standing on or adjacent to a stone surface who are struck by a critical hit on a tail spike Strike are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} is 17.

Tantriog.name: Tantriog
Tantriog.publicNotes:
Wherever exquisite cuisine is consumed, amazing songs are performed, or epic waves crest, there wait tantriogs. With a crab's foreclaws, turtle's shell, and back flippers, tantriogs are among the more unique water elementals. They ply the Boundless Sea constantly seeking new experiences, whether the next big wave to ride, a tasty delicacy to sample, or a piece of art to collect. They crave new sensations and often seek them out at the expense of others.

If one possesses rare art, lost lore, or fantastic surfing or cooking skills, a tantriog can be a wonderful companion. They're charming and friendly to those they find interesting, but their interest can be highly precarious, dropped the second someone bores them. Tantriogs may even betray acquaintances if it would give them another interesting story to tell. This makes befriending one a tricky proposition, as nothing can be taken for granted.

It's a mystery how tantriogs came to wear their current forms. Some say that, in the earliest days of the elemental planes, tantriogs were assassins of ice and mist who committed a crime so great that they're being punished for it to this day. Others claim tantriogs assumed their shape after losing a bizarre cosmic bet. One of the more popular theories about the tantriog's current form is that in the past, they used to be able to shift shape as easily as water molds to its container. In their endless boredom, they were trying out a variety of shapes when a sudden curse (possibly cast by faydhaans) caused them to lose their ability while transforming from a turtle to a crab, leaving them stuck between the two. It's said that any who can teach a tantriog how to relearn their morphing ability could earn the elemental's undying friendship. Whatever the case, the surest way to anger a tantriog is to ask them about their appearance.

Conversely, the surest way to befriend a tantriog is with compliments about their appearance or their skills. Don't be too fawning, though. Tantriogs don't like being tricked or made to look a fool.

IMPRESSING A TANTRIOG

A tantriog loves seeing a new sight or impressive exhibition of skill. Anyone who wants to stay in a tantriog's good graces needs to keep the new experiences flowing. For this reason, many tantriogs have formed unlikely friendships with gnomes, whose need to seek out new experiences provides common ground.

Shell Defense.name: Shell Defense
Shell Defense.description: The tantriog retracts their limbs and head into their shell and ends their turn. This increases their AC to 26, but they can't act except to reemerge, which they can do as a single action.

Listless Saliva.name: Listless Saliva
Listless Saliva.description: The tantriog's essence is imbued with their endless ennui. Any creature hit by the tantriog's beak or spitball Strikes must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).

Gluttonous Geode.name: Gluttonous Geode
Gluttonous Geode.publicNotes:
The vast ranks of earth elementals have been slow to respond to the return of the elemental lords and the Planes of Metal and Wood. These events have not broken the mountains, nor have they blown away the sands.

Earthy Emotions

Earth elementals talk even less than most elementals. They're ponderous, weighing decisions so slowly they can crush the energy from a discussion. Their foremost concern is whether a situation can be endured. Though a rare or resplendent treasure might entice an earth elemental, it's difficult to spur any sense of urgency in them without the presence of an immediate threat.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description: The geode Leaps up to 15 feet and makes a crystal teeth Strike. If it hits a creature larger than itself, it can attach to that creature. Doing so is like Grabbing the creature (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 17), but the geode moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The geode is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the geode is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage. Escaping the attached geode or removing the geode in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

Gnaw.name: Gnaw
Gnaw.description:
Requirements The geode is attached to a creature

Effect The geode deals @Damage[(1d4+2)[bludgeoning]] damage to the creature it's attached to (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|basic:true] save).

Solar Crow.name: Solar Crow
Solar Crow.publicNotes:
These enormous three-legged elementals resemble crows with flaming feathers, said to shine as bright as the sun. They nest in the smoldering Forest of Mulberry Coals, living in flocks of eight to a dozen, with ten being the most common.

The ifrits of the Dominion of Flame conscript even more of the plane's fire elementals in preparation for new wars in the returned planes, even mobilizing ones that rarely travel near settlements.

Story Of Infamy

Ancient tales from dragon-ruled Tian Xia tell of a flock of solar crows who wreaked havoc upon the Plane of Wood, driving an herb that could grant immortality to extinction before coming to terrorize Tian Xia itself. All but one of the crows were then shot down by a legendary archer.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a solar crow's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Glinting Wing.name: Glinting Wing
Glinting Wing.description:
Trigger A creature within 120 feet attempts to target the solar crow

Effect The solar crow defensively repositions a wing to shine light into the attacker's eyes. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for the duration of the triggering effect, granting the solar crow concealment against it.

Glow.name: Glow
Glow.description: 25 feet. The solar crow casts bright light in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:25] (and dim light for the next 25 feet).

Blinding Heat.name: Blinding Heat
Blinding Heat.description:
The solar crow expands its wings and unleashes blazing hot, blinding light in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[9d6[fire]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29] save. The crow can't use Blinding Heat again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Blinding Heat]]{1d4 rounds}, and its glow aura is deactivated during this time.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is blinded for 1 minute.

Burning Talons.name: Burning Talons
Burning Talons.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the solar crow takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]] damage. It can't recover from this damage while grabbed by the crow.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: A solar crow can Fly at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its talons, carrying that creature along with it.

Lithic Locus.name: Lithic Locus
Lithic Locus.publicNotes:
Civilizations die, buried by time, but their memory may yet linger in shattered pottery, collapsed edifices, and destroyed artwork, compressed and clarified under the weight of rock and soil. Some excavated sites might still hold a sliver of consciousness in their base materials, which walks again as an avatar of an extinct people when awakened. These lithic loci represent the triumphs and folly of their society. Speaking to one is speaking to a witness of an archaic time. The lithic locus's persona expresses their culture in all dimensions, and thus the attitudes of lithic loci vary greatly. Their appearances show the aesthetics and technology of their time, suspended in a cloud of excavated earth.

As plentiful as archaeological sites are in the Universe, the Plane of Earth holds countless more of far older provenance. Some of its inhabitants have even found lithic loci from peoples far older than themselves, seeing directly what would remain should they dwindle out of living memory. This has led some civilizations to even plan their decline by leaving a legacy in the living rock.

Ancient Finds

Lithic loci often contain important and valuable items. None of these elemental constructs are likely to agree to be looted, but some loci bestow their antiquities upon worthy successors, proud to see their culture's creations put to effective use in the modern day. Lithic loci can also direct earnest seekers to other lost treasures, helping to restore knowledge of an extinct society.

Antiques.name: Antiques
Antiques.description: A lithic locus contains at least one magic item. Any such antiques are durable, permanent items that were part of the locus's site and typify their culture. The locus receives the benefits of such an item as if wearing or holding it and can activate it. A lithic locus typically has an item of their level.

Bury.name: Bury
Bury.description: Any creature hit by the locus's ancient stone Strike is partially buried in a tide of earth and rock, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 34).

Echo the Past.name: Echo the Past
Echo the Past.description:
The locus calls forth a remnant of the past civilization to impart a lesson or control the present. Using this ability again ends any previous manifestation. The locus casts one of the following occult innate spells (DC 34) for the listed purpose.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} The dominated creature takes on the role of a historical figure or someone in the social hierarchy (such as high priest) from the locus's civilization.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ucf8eynbZMfUucjE]{Illusory Scene} The scene reenacts a historical event from the locus's civilization.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hghGRzOSzEl4UXdS]{Invoke Spirits} The spirits are drawn from the locus's memories of people from their civilization.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kOa055FIrO9Smnya]{Wall of Stone} The locus recreates the wall of a building from their civilization, complete with decorations.

Elemental Thicket.name: 元素灌木丛 Elemental Thicket
Elemental Thicket.publicNotes: 在宇宙中，植物生长遵循日、周、年和十年的时间尺度。相反，元素灌木丛不断地、在几秒钟内生长。这些扭动的活体木材群体是生长本身的元素化身，一旦出现便迅速膨胀，吞噬其路径中的一切。

Entangling Growth.name: 纠缠增长 Entangling Growth
Entangling Growth.description:
30尺

植物生命从元素灌木丛周围的所有土壤中冒出来，使周围5尺区域变为高等困难地形，周围30尺区域变为困难地形。该能力需要土壤，没有土壤对地形没有影响，比如加工过的石头，坚硬的岩石，开阔的水域等。

Wood Wisp.name: 木微灵 Wood Wisp
Wood Wisp.publicNotes:
如同其他微灵一样，木微灵漫游其所在的位面，并与其他微灵协调，一起在交响乐中徜徉。由于它们乐于结合，木微灵比其他木元素更频繁地出现在家乡位面之外，尽管与其他微灵相比仍然相对罕见。

木微灵的外形类似于椰子，后面拖着厚密的树枝团，这些树枝甚至更深层地掩盖和隐藏了带刺的藤蔓网。不幸的是，它们既不了解这些刺对肉体生物可能造成的痛苦，又因为急切地提供帮助而表现出非常亲密的身体接触。

Accord Essence.name: 和声要义 Accord Essence
Accord Essence.description:
触发 30尺内，在过去一个小时内受到微灵共鸣的增益的盟友被一次攻击作为目标；

效果 微灵将自身引爆，造成小范围的元素爆炸，赋予30尺内的，在过去一个小时内受到微灵共鸣增益的盟友获得等于元素当前生命值一半的临时生命。这些临时生命持续1小时。

使用该反应动作的微灵会被永久摧毁，并且仅能被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{祈愿术 Wish}仪式或者类似的强力效果复原。如果某个能力会阻止微灵的毁灭（例如，该微灵是被召唤的，并因此只会被送回），和声要义不会产生效果。

Resonance.name: 共鸣 Resonance
Resonance.description:
30尺。

所有微灵都按照与它们的元素协调的频率振动，与所有具有该特征的生物和效果共鸣，并增强它们。区域中的生物在具有植物或木特征的效果上的攻击骰和伤害骰获得+1状态加值；具有元素以及植物或木特征之一的生物在所有攻击和伤害骰上获得该加值。对木微灵来说，该加值也适用于所有非魔法木质武器，例如木杖和棍棒。

In Concert.name: 演奏中 In Concert
In Concert.description: 当木微灵在援助（Aid）时骰出大失败，它们改为得到失败，并且当它们骰出成功，它们改为获得大成功。

Rakkatak.name: Rakkatak
Rakkatak.publicNotes:
Pulsating organs and tumors squirm loosely within a sac of skin, all forming the misshapen lump that is the body of a rakkatak. The predator's eyes scan the area, shimmering in the smoke like glowing dots. Wriggling insectoid legs—varying in number from one rakkatak to another—hang from its bulbous body. These limbs flail chaotically as a rakkatak fights, only calming when it's time to eat or rest.

Most rakkataks fly alone, picking off meals in sudden swooping strikes, but they will occasionally form a flock. Despite having little faculty for communication with other creatures, rakkataks have a certain ravenous genius for hunting with kin. Typically, once one grabs prey, the others swoop in to latch on as well, ingesting their meal with leech-like mouths.

Rakkataks possess insatiable appetites to help them withstand the long periods of famine between their infrequent meals as they travel the expanses of the Plane of Fire. As a result, they easily overconsume if brought somewhere with more abundant fauna, like the Universe. A single rakkatak can hold a surprising quantity of offal, even growing in size as its body expands. It becomes more unwieldy the larger it gets, which planar biologists believe to be a survival tactic to keep a rakkatak from indulging its hunger until it quite literally bursts.

Ashen Hunting Grounds

Avoiding the blazing chaos and ifrit rule that typify much of the Plane of Fire, rakkataks prefer ashen wastelands as their hunting grounds. They dig simple burrows just barely below the surface, called rakkatak hills. Within, they can doze and digest in peace or lay and tend their horrifying eggs.

Exploding Guts.name: Exploding Guts
Exploding Guts.description:
When the rakkatak is critically hit or critically fails a Fortitude save, one of its organs bursts. Roll [[/br 1d4]] to determine what effect this has.

1 Trapped noxious gas rushes out. The rakkatak is pushed 10 feet away from the source of the triggering attack or effect.

2 Pus showers those nearby. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

3 The damage is severe. The rakkatak takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

4 Gelatinous rakkatak eggs explode forth and instantly hatch. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,piercing]] damage from the ravenous larvae.

Predator's Stare.name: Predator's Stare
Predator's Stare.description: The rakkatak turns its grotesque yet mesmerizing eyes upon one creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the rakkatak. While fascinated, the creature must spend at least 1 action each round moving closer to the rakkatak as expediently as possible, and can't intentionally move away from it. The fascination ends after 1 minute or when the rakkatak uses Predator's Stare again, whichever comes first.

Suck Innards.name: Suck Innards
Suck Innards.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the rakkatak's reach

Effect The rakkatak deals [[/r 3d6[untyped]] damage to the target (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|basic:true] save). If the creature takes at least 12 damage, the rakkatak regains @Damage[10[healing]]] HP.

Vault Keeper.name: 护窟者 Vault Keeper
Vault Keeper.publicNotes:
护窟者失去了莎莱祖尔的火花，寿命只有两到三千年。他们维持守护着铸窟族许多实验。

莎莱祖尔（Sairazul）创造铸窟族时，他们尚是不朽。她创造了65536名铸窟族，所有铸窟族均是依照她的形象所造，而所有铸窟族都被灌注了一片她的神性火花。在她被监禁期间，阿依尔祖（Ayrzul）使用未来灭绝的预示来操纵他们将其力量献祭给他。这次献祭将铸窟族分成了两类：32768名维持着莎莱祖尔精华的造窟者，和32768名不再永生的护窟者。万年来，铸窟族建造出了横亘土元素位面的巨大魔法文明，当此处不再有空间建设时，他们便离开了。在每个新世界上，铸窟族建造了自己的洞窟，进行着实验，无止境地寻求着帮助他们避免灭绝的线索。

洞窟之种 Vault Seeds

铸窟族使用洞窟之种来创造魔法地下洞穴，这是阿依尔祖为他们的献祭而奖赏给其种族的魔法工具。洞窟之种被用于创造了格拉利昂幽暗地域的奥瓦洞窟（Vaults of Orv），还有一场意外涉及到一枚脱离掌控的洞窟之种，被用于创造了神秘的翡翠尖塔（Emerald Spire）。

水晶工匠 Crystal Crafters

除了传承石和洞窟之种外，铸窟族精通于用水晶制作许多种类魔法物品。其中包括名为低语石（whisperstones）的黑石柱，能让铸窟族可以跨洞窟进行心灵感应交流，如同网状绿水晶隧道的奥瓦门，能够在幽暗地域洞窟之间传送，还有在奥瓦中一处名为水晶子宫（the Crystal Womb）的旋涡，连接着土元素位面上一座至关重要的要塞。

+2 Status to Recall Knowledge About Eart.name: 有关于土的回忆知识+2状态加值

Craft Crystal Wand.name: 制作水晶魔杖 Craft Crystal Wand
Craft Crystal Wand.description:
频率 每天两次

效果 护窟者花费10分钟使用放射性绿水晶制作一把魔杖，容纳有任意由其选择的5环及以下的土法术。魔杖可以被其他生物使用，但在一天结束后会碎成沙子，且不具有任何金钱价值。

Item Caster.name: 物品施法者 Item Caster
Item Caster.description: 护窟者可以从任意物品上施法（例如法杖或魔杖），如同它在他的法术表中。

Constraining Crystal.name: 水晶束缚 Constraining Crystal
Constraining Crystal.description: 当护窟者使用爪打击造成伤害时，发光的绿水晶簇会聚集在攻击位置。目标必须成功通过一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，持续1小时（或在大失败时陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}）。如果生物已经因水晶束缚陷入笨拙，后续的豁免失败将改为增加笨拙状态值，最大到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 4}。

Crystal Burst.name: 水晶爆 Crystal Burst
Crystal Burst.description: 锋利的碎片爆对120尺内的一处@Template[type:burst|distance:30]范围炸造成@Damage[15d6[piercing]|traits:item:frequency:limited]伤害，进行@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true]豁免。护窟者不能在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Crystal Burst]]{1d4轮}内再次使用水晶爆。

Slashing Surge.name: 挥砍狂潮 Slashing Surge
Slashing Surge.description: 护窟者行走或攀爬，并在移动中任意点进行两次爪打击。每次打击必须选择不同生物为目标。多重攻击减值直到两次攻击结束后才会增加。

Zuhra.name: Zuhra
Zuhra.publicNotes:
Zuhras, the genies of the elemental Plane of Metal, are bold and imposing, fond of being the center of attention and drawing a crowd with flashy performances, displays of skill, and tales of their personal victories. Despite their large personalities, their long-term relationships tend to be cool and somewhat distant; zuhras often make alliances but rarely form friendships, and the trust required for deeper relationships is rarer still. The few mortals who've gotten to know a zuhra often describe them as bombastic but emotionally aloof.

Since the reconnection with other planes, zuhras have sought out and formed bonds with other genies. They find their jabali cousins to be capable smithing partners, if a bit staid and dull. Zuhras rarely pay non-genie elementals any more than a passing glance, finding even the intelligent ones uninteresting to communicate with or hard to relate to.

Blinding Reflection.name: Blinding Reflection
Blinding Reflection.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The zuhra is in dim or bright light

Effect The zuhra briefly reshapes part of their metallic body into a concave surface to reflect the surrounding light into the eyes of a creature within 30 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26] save. It's then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the start of the zuhra's next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the start of the zuhra's next turn.

Nanoshard Swarm.name: 纳米碎片群 Nanoshard Swarm
Nanoshard Swarm.publicNotes: 这个奇异的实体实际上是由数万个构成部分组成的巨大集合体，每个部分都是一个小得像鹅卵石一样的微小金属球。由一个单一的元素精魂控制，该集群能够像液体一样流动穿过最小的开口，然后将自身塑造成强大的战斗者、坚固的墙壁或任何其他情况所需的形态。

Barrier Form.name: 屏障形态 Barrier Form
Barrier Form.description:
需求 纳米碎片群处于集群形态

效果 纳米碎片群形成一个连续的、厚6寸的固体墙壁，最长可达60尺，高10尺，起始于它当前空间的任何一个方格。墙壁可以沿任意路径形成，每5尺位于方格的边界上。它不需要垂直站立，因此可以形成桥梁或楼梯等。墙壁必须在一个连续的开放空间中形成，其边缘不能穿过任何生物或物体。

墙壁中的单个5尺×5尺部分可以通过对其造成18点伤害来摧毁，这也会减少集群的总生命值。处于屏障形态的纳米碎片群不能被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}或强制移动，也不能自行移动。处于屏障形态的纳米碎片群可以从其墙壁的任何方格发起触须打击。

Battle Form.name: 战斗形态 Battle Form
Battle Form.description:
需求 纳米碎片群处于集群形态

效果 纳米碎片群凝结成一个超大型形态，看起来像是人形或野兽，并且能够持握装备。在战斗形态下，它的速度为15尺，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，并具有以下打击。

近战 1 肢体 (触及20尺)，伤害 4d8+9钝击

Swarm Form.name: 集群形态 Swarm Form
Swarm Form.description: 纳米碎片群崩解成其自然形态：一片巨大的微小金属球海洋。它会丢下任何它持有的物品。处于集群形态时，纳米碎片群的速度为25尺，它可以通过任何足以让单个球体通过的区域而无需挤入（Squeeze），并且获得包卷能力。

Snapdrake.name: 花口龙 Snapdrake
Snapdrake.publicNotes: 熟练的木巨灵法师和园丁为了他们的巨灵长老的审美享受和保护需要，手工制作这些可爱的生物。制作花口龙首先需要痛苦地构建一个活体木材的龙形框架，然后将成千上万的五彩鲜艳的金鱼草花编织成复杂的图案，形成它们的身体和鳞片。一旦完成，花口龙通常作为守卫、宠物和装饰，为木巨灵服务，只要它们得到充足的食物。

Alluring Scent.name: 迷人芳香 Alluring Scent
Alluring Scent.description:
30尺

进入弥漫范围的生物必须尝试@Check[type:will|dc:25]豁免。如果失败，目标被花口龙@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}，并且在下个回合必须至少使用1个动作向花口龙行走以靠近它。如果成功，目标在1小时内免疫花口龙的迷人芳香。

Greater Forest Passage.name: 高等穿林 Greater Forest Passage
Greater Forest Passage.description: 花口龙无视植物和真菌造成的困难地形、高等困难地形。

Snapdrake Pollen.name: 花口龙花粉 Snapdrake Pollen
Snapdrake Pollen.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25];

最大持续 8轮

阶段1 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害外加@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目眩 Dazzled} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[1d6[poison]]伤害外加目眩和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1} (2轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害外加@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}和恶心1 (2轮)

Speed Surge.name: 速度激增 Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
频率 每日3次

效果 花口龙最多以双倍速度移动。

Spray Pollen.name: 喷射花粉 Spray Pollen
Spray Pollen.description:
花口龙对@Template[type:cone|distance:40]范围进行花粉吐息。暴露其中的生物必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true]豁免，否则将暴露在花口龙花粉的影响下。

花口龙在[[/br 1d6 #Recharge Spray Pollen]]{1d6轮}内无法再使用花粉喷射。

Dewdrop Jelly.name: Dewdrop Jelly
Dewdrop Jelly.publicNotes: Dewdrop jellies are small water elementals resembling jellyfish made of gelatinous bubbles. They typically travel in small schools, floating through the air or swimming through the endless seas of their home plane. When threatened, the jellies discorporate into a thin, vaporous mist, reconstituting into their bubble shape only after the danger has passed. Their clever elusiveness makes them hard to find, leading some to claim that dewdrop jellies are mythical flights of fancy told to entertain children.

Dissolve.name: Dissolve
Dissolve.description:
Trigger The dewdrop jelly takes damage from a hostile action

Effect The dewdrop jelly dissolves into a fine mist. Until the start of the jelly's next turn, it can't be attacked or targeted and doesn't take up space. At the end of the round, the jelly re-forms in any open space within 25 feet of where it Dissolved.

Overflow.name: Overflow
Overflow.description: The dewdrop jelly flattens its bell and shoots forward, Flying or Swimming twice in a straight line toward its target and attempting a tentacle Strike. On a success, the dewdrop attaches to the target's face, covering its mouth in the suspended water of its gelatinous body. If the target cannot breathe water, it begins to drown. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} is 16.

Jaathoom Shuyookh.name: Jaathoom Shuyookh
Jaathoom Shuyookh.languages: Can't Speak Any Language; Cloud Of Visions

Cloud of Visions.name: Cloud of Visions
Cloud of Visions.description: 120 feet. A jaathoom has telepathy 60 feet but can only show images rather than speaking.

Naturally Invisible.name: Naturally Invisible
Naturally Invisible.description: The jaathoom is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} at all times. They can become visible or return to invisibility as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Turbulent Skies.name: Turbulent Skies
Turbulent Skies.description: 20 feet. Swirling winds make all squares in the emanation difficult terrain for Striding and Flying creatures. Creatures with the air trait are immune. The jaathoom can activate or deactivate this aura as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Hurricane Blast.name: Hurricane Blast
Hurricane Blast.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The jaathoom moves all creatures without the air trait in their turbulent skies aura 20 feet directly away, clockwise, or counterclockwise. A creature avoids being moved if it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save.

Impressive Wish.name: Impressive Wish
Impressive Wish.description:
Frequency three times per year

Effect The shuyookh conducts a wish ritual for the benefit of a mortal, requiring no cost or secondary casters. The shuyookh's result is a success if they succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or a failure if not. The shuyookh's visions of the subject's future inform how it interprets the wish.

Ominous Dreams.name: Ominous Dreams
Ominous Dreams.description: The jaathoom sends a prophetic dream into the mind of a sleeping creature within 60 feet. An unwilling creature can avoid the vision if it succeeds at a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save. The jaathoom chooses the dream's subject but not its exact events. The target sees a brief vision of its future related to that subject, with the effect of augury. If the result is bad or mixed, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and doesn't start to recover from being frightened until it wakes.

Whipping Willow.name: 打人柳 Whipping Willow
Whipping Willow.publicNotes: 这些高大、纤细的身影过于树木化，不像树妖，但又过于人形化，不像树精。它们空白的脸和细长的躯干只略微暗示着人类特征。它们长长的、枝条般的手臂最终分裂成等比例的枝条般的手指，打人柳用它们进行战斗和在其家乡位面上摇摆穿行。

Grounded.name: 稳固 Grounded
Grounded.description: 当面对可能造成@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}的效果进行豁免时，打人柳的投掷结果提高一个成功度。此外，打人柳尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}敌人大失败时，自身不会陷入倒地。

Strangling Vines.name: 扼杀藤蔓 Strangling Vines
Strangling Vines.description: 当打人柳以藤鞭打击命中一个生物时，它能选择@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{攫抓 Grab}并掐住该生物。目标开始窒息，并且在被掐住期间不能说话。

Unseating Sweep.name: 失衡横扫 Unseating Sweep
Unseating Sweep.description: 打人柳尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}Template[type:cone|distance:15]区域的所有生物，尝试一次@Check[type:athletics|traits:action:trip]检定对抗所有目标的反射DC。

Fold Form.name: 折叠形态 Fold Form
Fold Form.description:
金折灵迅速展开并重新折叠自己的身体，从@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{动物形态 Animal Form}中选择一个新形态。这赋予她所选形态的移动速度和打击，但没有其他好处。它的攻击加值不变，伤害加值为+3。金折灵可以通过再次使用该动作恢复到它的自然形态，并且如果它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}的话会自动恢复原形。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.513Y2ZSzvm8rijkp]{效果: 折叠形态}

Carved Beast.name: 根雕野兽 Carved Beast
Carved Beast.publicNotes: 无数被雕刻成粗糙动物形状的树桩在木位面上漫游。这些根雕野兽的雕像部分无法进行灵活的运动，然而它们基座的活体木材却是完全有生命的。当被放任自由时，根雕野兽更喜欢粗略地模仿它们所类似的动物行为，就像孩子们用不灵活的玩具进行游戏。

Top-Heavy.name: 头重脚轻 Top-Heavy
Top-Heavy.description: 当根雕野兽没有在扎根状态时，他笨重的设计让它容易翻倒。将根雕野兽击至@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}的DC减少5，并且根雕野兽在对抗任何可能将其击倒的尝试时，其检定或豁免有-5状态减值。此外，当野兽尝试以树根打击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}敌人失败时，它得到大失败的结果。如果成功被一个敌人推撞，根雕野兽必须通过@Check[type:reflex|dc:20]豁免否则也会倒地。

Dig In.name: 扎根 Dig In
Dig In.description: 为了更好地防御和抓地，根雕野兽将其半埋在土里。当处于扎根状态时，根雕野兽不能行走，也不能使用树根打击；但是，这也让他更加稳定，让野兽的AC和强韧豁免有+2状态加值，并使其雕像打击伤害提高[[/r 1d8]]。根雕野兽可以在自己的回合花费1个动作来结束此效果；或者，当根雕野兽被强迫移动时，比如通过一次成功的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{推撞 Shove}，该效果也会结束。

Avalanche Legion.name: 山崩军团 Avalanche Legion
Avalanche Legion.publicNotes:
土元素位面的元素们领土意识都非常强烈。一些独行的元素独自保护自己的巢穴，但偶尔也会有其他元素联合起来保护更旷阔的共享领地。这些元素集合中更值得注意的是山崩军团，他们在这些共享领土的周边巡逻，入组那些胆敢入侵他们家园的入侵者。

家族本能 Familial Instincts

虽然元素不像一般生物那样繁殖，但活体山崩有时会和更小或更弱的土元素建立联系，例如土微灵、活体滚石以及苔犬。当这些较小的元素聚集在一起时，活体山崩会监护他们。山崩军团有时候会在这些元素聚合中形成，由多个活体山崩联合起来保护较弱小的元素。

Earthbound.name: 地缚 Earthbound
Earthbound.description: 当未接触坚实地面时，山崩军团陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

Earth Glide.name: 潜地 Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: 山崩军团能掘进穿过任何土质材料，包括岩石。当它如此做时，军团以满速移动，并且不会留下隧道或通过的痕迹。

Pummeling Boulders.name: 连打石拳 Pummeling Boulders
Pummeling Boulders.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 山崩军团的石拳雨点般砸向5尺内的每个敌人 (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true]豁免)，伤害基于动作数量。

1 @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]]伤害

2 @Damage[(3d8+8)[bludgeoning]]伤害

3 @Damage[(4d8+11)[bludgeoning]]伤害

Spinning Stones.name: 飞旋石块 Spinning Stones
Spinning Stones.description: 山崩军团在原地高速旋转，甩出如弹幕一般的石块。部队30尺内@Template[type:burst|distance:10]范围内的每个生物受到@Damage[(2d12+10)[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true]豁免）。当部队减少到8格或更少，该区域减少为@Template[type:burst|distance:5]。

Trample into the Earth.name: 碾进土里 Trample into the Earth
Trample into the Earth.description: 山崩军团向前突进，以巨石身体碾过并击倒生物。效果同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]{践踏 Trample}；巨型或更小，@Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true]。大失败的生物还会被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Troop Movement.name: 部队移动 Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: 当山崩军团掘进或行走时，它首先以一个自由动作重整队列，聚集成20尺*20尺方格的队列（减去任何损失的方格），然后最多以满速度移动。它在移动时如同一个巨形生物那般；举例来说，如果任何方格进入了困难地形，则整个部队都需要花费额外的移动力。

Veiled Current.name: Veiled Current
Veiled Current.publicNotes:
Often considered cousins of phades, veiled currents are loose veils of wind who catch prey within their folds.

Many elementals that roam the Plane of Air embody the mercurial formlessness and chaos of tumultuous storms.

Tempestuous Spirits

Air elementals are often flighty contrarians, often more concerned with bringing about change than with the specific changes they enact. Art and writing created by such elementals is exceptionally rare, as they usually destroy their projects once the challenge and excitement of completing them fades.

Invisible Courtiers

Formless and invisible elementals are the favored children of Hshurha, the air elementals' mother goddess. They receive favorable treatment in her realm, Verglas Precessional, where they serve as trusted advisors, emissaries to other planes, and members of her personal retinue, in addition to performing clandestine tasks the goddess wishes to keep hidden.

Naturally Invisible.name: Naturally Invisible
Naturally Invisible.description: The veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} at all times. When they take a hostile action of any kind, the veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} instead of undetected as the vague outline of their humanoid form becomes faintly visible until the start of their next turn.

Envelop.name: Envelop
Envelop.description:
Requirements The veiled current begins their turn with a target of their size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The veiled current maintains the Grab and coalesces around the creature, stretching themself into a semisolid veil that smothers the creature within. This thereafter has the same effect as if the veiled current had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (DC 26, 1d8+8 bludgeoning, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 26, Rupture 17). As engulfing a creature is a hostile action, the veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} instead of undetected every round it has a creature engulfed.

Kizidhar.name: Kizidhar
Kizidhar.publicNotes:
Kizidhars look like walking trees, averaging 10 to 12 feet tall with branches twisting to form their arms, faces, and other features. A kizidhar can reshape their body to create any wooden object.

The genies of the Plane of Wood, known as the kizidhars, are overbearing lords of their element. These master crafters of wood specialize in carpentry and all kinds of woodcarving, and they take a particular delight in reshaping the world in their own image—either through creating wooden statues of themselves or by manipulating and controlling the living things around them. Though they're able to carve themselves similarly, they usually regard their own forms as perfect.

Shunning the company of other genies, they prefer to avoid those equal in power and instead surround themselves with circles of sycophants and flatterers. With the pathways to the Universe open again for the first time in ages, kizidhars roam the multiverse to find mortals they can tempt into joining their palace retinues as servants, entertainers, and valuable sources of new information.

Parting the Trees.name: Parting the Trees
Parting the Trees.description: The genie ignores difficult terrain from plants, and can share their space with larger plants, such as trees.

Sculpt Wood.name: Sculpt Wood
Sculpt Wood.description: The kizidhar creates a wooden item out of their body that appears in their hand and remains attached. The item can be a one-handed simple weapon, shield, or object of light Bulk. A kizidhar can instead use this ability to transform an item it's already holding or to remove an object to free its hand. Any item created with Sculpt Wood crumbles to splinters if removed from the kizidhar's possession.

Take Root.name: Take Root
Take Root.description: The genie thrusts their weapon into the ground. Plants sprout and grow out of the ground in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] centered on one corner of the kizidhar's square. All squares on the ground in that area are difficult terrain until the kizidhar uses this ability again.

Ore Louse.name: Ore Louse
Ore Louse.publicNotes:
Ore lice are six-legged insectile creatures that roost either just beneath or above the water's surface. They're highly territorial toward both strangers and each other, able to detect an intruder through the ripples in the water. Due to their diet, ore lice have incredibly tough chitin that's infused with metal. Cannibalism between ore lice is common when they're unable to locate other prey.

Though there are far more suitable environments for ore lice bordering the Plane of Air, the creatures are often found where the Plane of Earth meets the Plane of Water. This was a mystery that puzzled many—until the Plane of Metal returned between the Planes of Earth and Water. Planar researchers realized that ore lice must have hunted here before the planar schism. On the Plane of Metal, ore lice often appear in horror stories chasing down metal elementals and ferociously devouring them. Their connection to Ferrumnestra adds to their infamy.

Metal Scent.name: Metal Scent
Metal Scent.description: An ore louse can smell metal as a precise sense.

Consume Living Metal.name: Consume Living Metal
Consume Living Metal.description:
Requirements The ore louse is adjacent to a creature that died within the last hour and had the metal trait or was another ore louse

Effect An ore louse can replenish its health by eating the remains of its kin or a once-living metal creature. The ore louse feasts upon the corpse, regaining 3d6 Hit Points. The ore louse can regain Hit Points from a given corpse only once.

Metal Snack.name: Metal Snack
Metal Snack.description: An ore louse gains 5 temporary Hit Points each time its mandibles Strike either damages or breaks a metal item using its rust ability, or if it hits a creature that has the metal trait or is made of metal.

Rust.name: Rust
Rust.description: An ore louse's Strikes causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If it succeeds at a mandibles or oxidizing spit Strike, the ore louse deals 3d6 damage (or double damage on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the ore louse hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the attacks, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack.

Water Stride.name: Water Stride
Water Stride.description: The ore louse can stand and move on the surface of water or other liquids without falling through. The ore louse can go underwater if it wishes, but it must Swim to do so.

Jann Shuyookh.name: Jann Shuyookh
Jann Shuyookh.publicNotes: Regarded as the progenitors of geniekind, janns hold a position of esteem above the genies tied to specific planes. They possess an inborn ability to grant wishes, which the other branches of geniekind lack and greatly envy. Nomadic jann shuyookhs rarely hold court, preferring to gather only when the need arises to perform great deeds. Lesser janns respect and venerate these leaders for their wisdom and total dedication to preserving the honor and reputation of their people. A jann shuyookh reads portents and omens when dealing with duplicitous mortals.

Commanding Presence.name: Commanding Presence
Commanding Presence.description:
20 feet.

A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure), and is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. A genie (with the exception of another jann) takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their save.

Elemental Resistance.name: Elemental Resistance
Elemental Resistance.description: The jann shuyookh's elemental resistance applies to cold, electricity, and fire damage, as well as all damage from elemental sources (including environmental damage from the elemental planes and damage from anything with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood trait).

All Made One.name: All Made One
All Made One.description:
The jann shuyookh calls upon all the elements that make up their being and chooses one. They gain an additional arcane spell they can cast at will and empower their Strikes with the element, dealing an extra 1d6 damage of the listed type. These benefits last until the shuyookh uses this ability again.

  • Air: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Earth: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Fire: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, 1d6 fire;
  • Metal: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3A3ueS9Q0s3U8KXE]{Noxious Metals}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Water: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LNOwaJAkCfsgTKgV]{Wall of Water}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Wood: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}, 1d6 piercing.

Wanderer's Wish.name: Wanderer's Wish
Wanderer's Wish.description:
Frequency three times per year

Effect The jann instantly grants the benefits of a critical success with the wish ritual to a mortal creature. This has no cost. That creature specifies what they wish for, but the interpretation is up to the jann. A jann typically attempts to grant wishes in a way that encourages growth and exploration. A summoned jann can't use this ability.

Murajau.name: Murajau
Murajau.publicNotes:
Murajaus, one of many nomadic creatures of the Plane of Water, appear humanoid from the waist up but resemble a large hermit crab from the waist down, including a pair of strong pincers. Murajau communities are often multilingual, and many individuals are willing to work as translators and guides to adventurers if properly compensated. Rather than currency, murajaus prefer to deal in trinkets such as talismans, particularly those that protect travelers. For murajaus, such items signify their sincerity and unwavering desire to protect others. They trade tales among each other of treasure troves too dangerous to easily explore. Rather than keep this information solely for themselves, they're happy to share it with trustworthy people they meet in exchange for a small share.

Faydhaans tell condescending tales of murajaus, describing their origin as royal servants who failed to fulfill a royal decree. Murajaus' own creation story, meanwhile, claims that the royal decree in question requested they travel the lands to provide shelter and hospitality to visitors, a mission they have since carried on for generations. They take great pride in treating guests well, especially in providing suitable food, drink, and gifts.

To murajaus, one's shell signifies homestead, status, identity, and cultural inheritance. Community elders and leaders often wear shells passed down from a long line of successors, which carry modifications and marks that denote predecessors' achievements and failures. On the occasion that their community numbers exceed the number of shells available, a hunting season might be declared. Participants who return with suitable trophies are revered for their contribution and bravery.

Hefty Defense.name: Hefty Defense
Hefty Defense.description: A murajau's weight and legs make them incredibly difficult to trip or be moved unwillingly. They can be tripped only by creatures of their size or larger and have a +2 circumstance bonus to all defenses against being shoved or tripped. However, a murajau can Stand only as a 2-action activity.

Retract.name: Retract
Retract.description: The murajau fully retreats into their shell, gaining greater cover; the bonus to Stealth applies only if the murajau is undetected. While in their shell, the murajau can't see outside and takes a –2 circumstance penalty to auditory Perception checks. The only move actions the murajau can take are to Stand or Step. The murajau can come back out as a single action.

Talisman Faithful.name: Talisman Faithful
Talisman Faithful.description: A murajau can affix talismans to their shell as though it were heavy armor, and they can affix up to three talismans to it at a time instead of one.

Swinging Spear.name: Swinging Spear
Swinging Spear.description: The murajau makes a spear Strike. On a hit, the murajau twists their spear to move the target to any space adjacent to the murajau and deals an additional @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]] damage as the target smashes into the murajau's thick shell.

Veldenar.name: Veldenar
Veldenar.publicNotes:
Some dangers lurking within the Endless Sky can doom prey before they even realize it; such are the ambush tactics of the 20-foot-tall elementals known as veldenars. Their inherent invisibility and pale, almost translucent forms make them among the most deadly creatures to call the Plane of Air home.

Veldenars resemble amphibians from the Universe, albeit with myriad red eyes and an affinity for cold. Hunting along the edges of eternal storms, the event horizons of dead zones, and the banks of sky streams, veldenars prey on the lesser denizens of their home plane. They can often be found using their natural buoyancy to drift among the large chunks of magical ice that crossed onto the Plane of Air from its former border with the Plane of Water. There, they extend their tongues to trap unwary flying insects or adventurers who might happen to float by. Their multiple eyes keep watch for their next meal even while devouring current prey.

The intense cold of a veldenar's stomach rapidly incapacitates its victims, allowing the predator to focus on returning to invisibility and finding a secluded spot to digest. Victims who escape the veldenar's stomach often feel chilled to the bone for days.

Veldenars aren't discerning about who or what they inhale. As a result, kinds of scrap can collect in their stomachs, especially inorganic material. Those hunting veldenars often wait until the elemental needs to regurgitate debris, as this is one of the few times a veldenar can be caught in a compromising position, unable to capture anything due to their clogged esophagus.

Paired Predators

Veldenars bond in partnership for life, which can be well over a century. Utilizing their ambush pack tactics, one veldenar will often drive potential prey into their partner's clutches. Visitors to the Plane of Air should keep in mind that if they happen to spot one veldenar, another is likely close by.

Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
Natural Invisibility.description: A veldenar is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} and only becomes visible when using a hostile action. Creatures it has engulfed remain visible within it, albeit slightly blurred by the veldenar's translucent skin.

Viscous Breath.name: Viscous Breath
Viscous Breath.description: 15 feet. The veldenar raises the viscosity of the surrounding air just by breathing it. Creatures who enter or start their turn within the emanation treat the area as difficult terrain and take a –2 status penalty to any non-magical physical attacks they attempt. This aura is suppressed whenever the veldenar has a creature engulfed.

Vacuum.name: Vacuum
Vacuum.description:
Requirements The veldenar doesn't have a creature engulfed

Effect The veldenar forcefully unlocks then expands its jaws to inhale the air in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] before it, pulling Large or smaller creatures into its cavernous maw. The veldenar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfs} the creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27], @Damage[(1d10+10)[cold]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 27, Rupture 25).

Twins of Rowan.name: 孪生花楸木 Twins of Rowan
Twins of Rowan.publicNotes: 孪生花楸木是木位面上最强大的元素之一，专门用于巡逻广阔的荒野，维护木位面精心构建的秩序。尽管有两个头和躯干，但每一对孪生花楸木 都是一个独特的生物;像所有的木元素一样，它们真正的意识不在头部，而在根部，它们真正的身体是树干，而不是伸出来的四肢。

Shielded Eyes.name: 受护双目 Shielded Eyes
Shielded Eyes.description: 孪生花楸木的保护性面具让他们免受目盲和目眩效果影响。

Beacon of the Rowan Guard.name: 花楸守卫信标 Beacon of the Rowan Guard
Beacon of the Rowan Guard.description:
40尺。

孪生花楸木携带的灯笼包含了纯净的元素生命能量，与所有的木元素产生共鸣并赋予它们力量。在灵光的弥漫范围中，具有元素特征以及具有植物或木特征的生物获得10点快速治疗、且攻击骰和伤害骰有+2环境加值。灵光可以通过DC 30的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic}来反制，这样做会使灵光失效[[/br 1d6 #Rounds Deactivated]]轮。

Follow-Up Combo.name: 跟进连击 Follow-Up Combo
Follow-Up Combo.description: 孪生花楸木对同一个目标进行一次细剑打击，然后是两次拳头打击。这些攻击都计算孪生花楸木的多重攻击减值，但减值在所有攻击结束后才增加。

Lifespring Burst.name: 生命之泉爆发 Lifespring Burst
Lifespring Burst.description: 每日1次，孪生花楸木可以用他们的剑攻击地面，以双胞胎为中心释放@Template[type:burst|distance:30]的生命能量爆发，造成@Damage[14d6[vitality]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|basic:true]豁免）；孪生花楸木免疫此效果。受这种爆发影响的地区，随着充满活力的新植物在其中疯长，变为高等困难地形。

Living Magma.name: Living Magma
Living Magma.publicNotes:
Living magmas can lie dormant for centuries below the earth before they awaken from their slumber in a fiery a volcanic eruption. This is especially dangerous when entire colonies of the molten elementals arise at the same time.

The ifrits of the Dominion of Flame conscript even more of the plane's fire elementals in preparation for new wars in the returned planes, even mobilizing ones that rarely travel near settlements.

Molten Form.name: Molten Form
Molten Form.description: Any creature that hits the living magma with an unarmed Strike or otherwise touches it takes @Damage[10[fire]] damage. If a gallon or more of water touches the living magma, or if it's affected by a water effect, its outer layer of lava hardens to a rocky shell, deactivating its molten form and imposing weakness 15 to bludgeoning damage. Molten form reactivates if the living magma swims in lava for 1 minute.

Trap Weapon.name: Trap Weapon
Trap Weapon.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A creature hits the living magma with a melee weapon

Effect The living magma attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:athletics] check against the triggering creature's Athletics DC. On a success, the living magma traps the weapon in its body and pulls it from the attacker's grasp. A creature can Interact to retrieve the weapon, but the attempt fails unless the creature succeeds at an @Check[type:athletics|dc:resolve(@actor.system.saves.fortitude.dc)] check against the living magma's Fortitude DC (typically 36). If the living magma uses Engulf, it also absorbs all trapped weapons, rendering them unreachable until it dies.

Launch Lava.name: Launch Lava
Launch Lava.description: The living magma hurls an exploding glob of lava up to 120 feet. Each creature in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] takes @Damage[7d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true] save).

Reignite.name: Reignite
Reignite.description:
Requirements The living magma is not in molten form

Effect The living magma returns to molten form.

Volcanic Heat.name: Volcanic Heat
Volcanic Heat.description: 40 feet. Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the aura takes @Damage[15[fire]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true] save). A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until it's no longer in the aura.

A Thousand Cuts.name: 凌迟 A Thousand Cuts
A Thousand Cuts.description: 黑铁蝴蝶刀片状的翅膀造成的可怕撕裂会导致持续流血。任何被黑铁蝴蝶蝶翼打击伤害而导致陷入持续流血的生物，在流血期间还会受到2挥砍弱点。

Swoop.name: 猛扑 Swoop
Swoop.description: 黑铁蝴蝶最多以满速飞行，并且在移动中的任意一点进行一次蝶翼打击。

Sootsoldiers.name: 煤烟士兵 Sootsoldiers
Sootsoldiers.publicNotes: 强大的神祇和军阀为了证明火的至高无上，因此在火元素位面和内环宇宙的其余部分争夺通知地位。燃烧着火焰的士兵们在硝烟弥漫的战场上相互厮杀，但无法发挥自己的全部力量。伊莫利（Ymeri），这位恶毒的狱火女王（Queen of the Inferno），指挥着大量的煤烟士兵：这些元素能够与她的敌人的军队作战，即使被摧毁，也能从永恒之炉（Eternal Furnace）的灰烬中重生，燃烧着冲天烈火并取得胜利。

Ashen Smoke.name: 灰烟 Ashen Smoke
Ashen Smoke.description: 当煤烟士兵的生命值下降至某个阈值，或减少至0时，被摧毁的士兵将会炸成一团充满烟灰的云团，@Template[type:burst|distance:20]范围，以煤烟士兵为中心。烟雾内所有生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}，并且烟雾外的所有生物对里面的生物隐蔽。烟雾持续1分钟，或直到被强风吹散。

Incinerating Grasp.name: 焚化之握 Incinerating Grasp
Incinerating Grasp.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 煤烟士兵用燃烧的手掌抓握5尺范围内的所有敌人(@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免)。伤害和额外效果基于它花费的动作。

1 @Damage[2d8[fire]]伤害

2 @Damage[(3d8+7)[fire]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{受擒 Grabbed}

3 @Damage[(4d8+7)[fire]]伤害和擒抱

Seething Flash.name: 高温闪光 Seething Flash
Seething Flash.description: 煤烟士兵燃起明亮的火光冲过战场，重整队列并且行走两次。在此行动结束时，一股火焰和高热从煤烟士兵身上倾泻而出，对@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]范围内的生物造成@Damage[4d8[fire]]伤害，@Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true]豁免。大大失败的生物还会被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Smoke Vision.name: 烟雾视觉 Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: 煤烟士兵无视烟雾带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

Troop Movement.name: 部队移动 Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: 当煤烟士兵行走时，它首先以一个自由动作重整队列，聚集成20尺*20尺方格的队列（减去任何损失的方格），然后最多以满速度移动。它在移动时如同一个巨形生物那般；举例来说，如果任何方格进入了困难地形，则整个部队都需要花费额外的移动力。

Despairing Pall.name: Despairing Pall
Despairing Pall.publicNotes:
Despairing palls are small, dark clouds that float aimlessly through the Plane of Air, casting literal and emotional shadows wherever they go. Pranksters and mischievous elementalists often summon them to rain on a rival's parade.

Many elementals that roam the Plane of Air embody the mercurial formlessness and chaos of tumultuous storms.

Tempestuous Spirits

Air elementals are often flighty contrarians, often more concerned with bringing about change than with the specific changes they enact. Art and writing created by such elementals is exceptionally rare, as they usually destroy their projects once the challenge and excitement of completing them fades.

Invisible Courtiers

Formless and invisible elementals are the favored children of Hshurha, the air elementals' mother goddess. They receive favorable treatment in her realm, Verglas Precessional, where they serve as trusted advisors, emissaries to other planes, and members of her personal retinue, in addition to performing clandestine tasks the goddess wishes to keep hidden.

Duskflow.name: Duskflow
Duskflow.description:
Trigger The despairing pall is damaged by a melee Strike

Effect Darkness billows out from the despairing pall, covering its attacker in inky shadow. The despairing pall immediately Steps up to 15 feet in any direction. If the despairing pall took the triggering damage due to a reaction it provoked by moving, it can then finish the movement. For one round, the triggering attacker is cloaked in darkness and perceives light as one step lower (bright light becomes dim light, for example), affecting its ability to sense creatures and objects accordingly.

Downcast.name: Downcast
Downcast.description:
The despairing pall Flies up to its Speed, then rains gloom and despair in a @Template[type:line|distance:15] straight down. Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:16] save or take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls until the end of the despairing pall's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.zjVBG6uDd4WKWeKU]{Effect: Downcast}

Metal Wisp.name: 金微灵 Metal Wisp
Metal Wisp.publicNotes: 金微灵是一团由锈迹粒子和尖锐金属碎片组成的旋转球体，它们狂热地围绕着一个类似于凡人生物头骨的液态金属核心——通常是人形生物的头骨，但动物甚至更奇幻的头骨也不少见。与来自其他元素位面的微灵相比，金微灵不容易形成依恋或联系。其他元素位面的微灵往往认为金属微灵过于忧郁或沉重，尽管金微灵自从位面割裂后仍保留着一定的好奇心。

Rust Vision.name: 锈蚀视觉 Rust Vision
Rust Vision.description: 金微灵无视锈蚀云带来的隐蔽状态。

Resonance.name: 共鸣 Resonance
Resonance.description:
30尺。

所有微灵都按照与它们的元素协调的频率振动，与所有具有该特征的生物和效果共鸣，并增强它们。区域中的生物如果持握金属武器，或者使用金特征的效果时，其攻击骰和伤害骰获得+1状态加值；具有元素以及金特征的生物在所有攻击和伤害骰上获得该加值。

Rust Cloud.name: 锈蚀云 Rust Cloud
Rust Cloud.description: 金微灵周围环绕着铁锈渣组成的云团，因此它对距离超过5尺的生物具有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{隐蔽 Concealed}。

Munsahir Trooper.name: Munsahir Trooper
Munsahir Trooper.publicNotes:
Highly skilled troopers mostly come from the bronze class.

Munsahirs build militaristic, traditional societies.

Munsahir Hierarchy

The three strata of munsahir society can be observed in the kilts worn by all members. Nobles, the unimpeachable rulers, wear elaborate brass kilts. In the middle of society are businesspeople and traders bedecked in bronze. Raw copper adorns those in the working class, who do most of the building and hard labor for munsahir society. Officially speaking, there is no class mobility; horrible crimes might cause a brass noble to be sent to prison but can't cause them to lose their station.

Heat of the Forge.name: Heat of the Forge
Heat of the Forge.description: 10 feet. An munsahir's skin radiates heat like a forge's fire. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} while it remains in the area. Creatures immune to environmental heat effects or with any fire resistance are immune.

Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
Self-Destruct.description: When the munsahir is reduced to 0 HP, their armor explodes at the start of their next turn, dealing @Damage[5d6[fire]] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]).

Burning Touch.name: Burning Touch
Burning Touch.description: The munsahir gatecrasher's Strikes deal an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (included above). When the gatecrasher successfully performs a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} action, they also deal @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage to their target.

Living Grove.name: 活体林地 Living Grove
Living Grove.publicNotes:
活体林地是一个单一连接的实体，拥有几十个基因相同的树干，统一在同一个根系中。休息时，活体林地看起来就像一小片白桦和白杨树的植物园，尽管也存在更大、更坚固的橡树和红杉品种。

乍一看，木元素似乎不像火元素、水元素或气元素兄弟那样具有破坏性，但不要被表面愚弄了，森林可能是个危险的地方。

虽然有些像动物，但是这里展示的元素生物依然是植物，它们的生命周期反映了这一点。蔬菜羊长在有根的茎上，直到它们成熟（或者可能成熟）才能从茎上移走，这使得它们依赖于周围的环境来获取养分。苔藓树懒在它们生长出来的第一个世纪里，只不过是一堆绿色的绒毛，只有当它们长出防御性的木爪时，它们才能获得有限的行动能力。

野性但不野生 Wild But Unwild

许多木元素由木巨灵和木位面上的其他强大生物创造，并被赋予固定角色。它们充满自然保护区和广阔的庄园，一旦被释放到野外，可能不确定如何行动。它们本质上是被驯化出生的，即使在自然环境中，它们的行为也可能与它们模仿的野生生物大相径庭。它们的天敌很少，使元素生物面临的风险较小，尽管它们有时仍被巨型白蚁吃掉或被一些人当作宠物捕捉。

不叫大脑的大脑 A Brain By Any Other Name

即使是木元素的祖先被树木伮女士（Lady Shumunue）教导模仿动物，木元素的意识也不在大脑中，而是在其根系中。像苗圃爬行者、活体林地和根雕野兽这样的实体利用这一优势。木元素的木质身体可以被雕刻和制作，显然没有长期伤害，这意味着只要它们的根部没有受损，它们可能不会感到疼痛。

Defensive Camouflage.name: 防护性伪装 Defensive Camouflage
Defensive Camouflage.description: 活化林地能在自然环境中@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{躲藏 Hide}，哪怕它没有掩蔽。在躲藏中时，根系被泥土安全地覆盖，赋予活体林地的AC +3状态加值。重击会击碎这层土壤保护层，结束该效果。

Ifrit Shuyookh.name: Ifrit Shuyookh
Ifrit Shuyookh.publicNotes:
The leaders and luminaries of ifrits come from the wise but cruel shuyookhs. These spiteful manipulators lord their might over other genies and twist mortal greed into grief. Ifrit shuyookhs guide the Dominion of Flame with their vicious whims and unwavering belief in ifrit supremacy.

Hot Gossip

Scion of the noble but disgraced Mishalq family, the ifrit information broker Qalkami Mishalq emerged from exile and returned to the Dominion of Flame following the death of Sultan Suleiman XXII. Qalkami used contacts in the Pathfinder Society to eliminate her rivals in the Cinderfury family and step into a power vacuum of her own creation, expanding her control and influence among the great nobility of Medina Mudii'a.

Burning Grasp.name: Burning Grasp
Burning Grasp.description: When the ifrit Grabs or restrains a creature, that creature takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage, and takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage at the end of each of its turns until freed.

Combat Grab.name: Combat Grab
Combat Grab.description:
Requirements The ifrit shuyookh has a hand free

Effect The shuyookh makes a melee Strike. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the shuyookh's free hand.

Pedantic Wish.name: Pedantic Wish
Pedantic Wish.description:
Frequency three times per year

Effect The shuyookh conducts a wish ritual for the benefit of a mortal, requiring no cost or secondary casters. The shuyookh's result is a success if they succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] or a failure if not. The shuyookh subverts the wish-maker's true intentions, twisting the phrasing to maximize suffering.

Olobigonde.name: Olobigonde
Olobigonde.publicNotes:
Though the Plane of Water is mostly liquid, it does contain its share of solid material, whether in the form of free-floating aquatic plants, hunks of coral, or even detritus from lost underwater cities. Flotsam and jetsam collect across the plane, and olobigondes are just one of the many creatures that have evolved to live among and consume this detritus. These flat, round fish are covered in a moss-like skin that makes them exceptionally difficult to spot as they hug the sides of flotsam, feeding off the waste that drifts into their wide, open mouths.

While olobigondes are primarily detritivores, they've been known to lie in wait within a forest of kelp or against a mossy stone to ambush smaller creatures, such as water scamps or lone passing merfolk. The fish launch themselves from their hiding spot to take large bites out of their surprised prey, then grab the victim as it tries to flee. Despite their size and ungainly shape, olobigondes can move quickly in water, though their bursts of speed are usually short-lived. In addition to maintaining a firm hold on prey, olobigondes' mouths are filled with a unique toxin that weakens and decomposes living flesh. The hungry fish easily gulp down the resulting slurry.

Ancient olobigondes grow truly immense, and their outward appearance evolves. There seems to be no limit to their size. Their skin even separates into plates with deep channels where water can accumulate, giving them the appearance of an entire patch of detritus rather than one piece.

Alchemists who travel the planes have discovered how readily an olobigonde's toxin can decompose flesh, and some have discovered ways to incorporate it into their creations. An olobigonde's corpse yields approximately 1 gp worth of raw materials when harvested with a successful @Check[type:crafting|dc:16] or Survival check (2 gp worth on a critical success). This material can be used only to craft alchemical bombs with the poison trait.

Ambush.name: Ambush
Ambush.description:
Trigger A target creature passes within 20 feet of the olobigonde's hiding place and has not detected the olobigonde

Effect The olobigonde lunges out of its hiding place, Swims directly toward the triggering creature, and makes a jaws Strike against it. The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this attack.

Decomposing Toxin.name: Decomposing Toxin
Decomposing Toxin.description: A living creature struck by an olobigonde's jaws Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and take [[/r 1d6[poison,persistent]]] damage (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} with [[/r 2d6[poison,persistent]]] damage on a critical failure). The enfeebled condition ends when the persistent damage does. A creature currently affected by decomposing toxin doesn't need to save again.

Reactive Grab.name: Reactive Grab
Reactive Grab.description:
Trigger A creature within the olobigonde's reach leaves a square during a move action it's using

Requirements The olobigonde doesn't have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The olobigonde attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature with its jaws. On a success, the target also takes @Damage[3[piercing]] damage (doubled on a critical success).

Lomori Sprout.name: Lomori Sprout
Lomori Sprout.publicNotes:
Lomori sprouts are passionate gardeners who closely tend new growth on the Plane of Wood. Incredibly industrious, they lovingly guide young plants into elaborate constructions and patterns, forming tree tunnels, spiraling fields of flowers, complex hedge mazes, towering tapestries of interwoven bamboo, and other dizzying creations. Lomori sprouts meticulously collect the trimmings, seeds, and debris from the flora in their care. They plant the seeds to yield new growth and frenetically weave the rest into nests, spheres, and other simple objects. They're shy and skittish, often losing themselves in their labors, but they're always friendly to those who treat their gardens with respect.

Lomoris are aeon spirits dispatched to the elemental planes long ago to pursue the act of creation. While most of the aeons dispatched to the other elemental planes performed their duties and rejoined their aeon brethren, those on the Plane of Wood lingered, becoming trapped as the plane receded. Over the ages, they adapted and evolved into lomoris. Today, lomoris have more in common with the other denizens of the Plane of Wood than they do with their aeon ancestors.

Lomori sprouts, much like conrasus, have a central black sphere, known as a lomori's core, that functions as their primary body and consciousness. Where conrasus forge a sturdy exoskeleton, lomoris cultivate a tall mound of prairie grass surrounding their core, which easily grows to be 2–3 times the core's height. The lomori shapes the mound as it grows, creating protective layers to guard their core and forming other useful appendages. Most lomoris have six intricately detailed, crab-like legs of wood that emerge from the lower half of their core, allowing them to rapidly scuttle across the ground or climb trees.

Scurry.name: Scurry
Scurry.description:
Trigger A creature the lomori sprout can observe attacks the sprout;

Effect After the attack resolves, the lomori sprout can Stride up to their speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions from the triggering creature.

Greater Forest Passage.name: Greater Forest Passage
Greater Forest Passage.description: The lomori sprout ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from plants and fungi.

Take Root.name: Take Root
Take Root.description:
Requirements The lomori sprout is on the ground

Effect The lomori sprout plants themself in the ground. Grasping roots erupt from the ground in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] within 60 feet of the lomori sprout, dealing @Damage[4d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true] save) to creatures in the area; on a failed save, a creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition until it Escapes (DC 20). The roots also make the area difficult terrain for 1 minute, after which they decompose into fertile mulch; the area is no longer difficult terrain, and any creatures still immobilized by the roots automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Skymetal Striker.name: 天金打击者 Skymetal Striker
Skymetal Striker.publicNotes:
天金打击者看起来像一条蛇，或更准确地说，像一种被称为双头蛇的两头蛇，由一串数十个旋转的、带锯齿的圆锯片构成。这些锯片沿着生物的身体排列，就像珠子串在一根看不见的磁力线上。尽管构成该生物的刀片通常由许多不同的金属和合金组成，但它以形成其蛇形身体两端的山铜和虚铅利刃而闻名、令人畏惧，并以此得名。

金元素生物可以以多种不同形式出现，从不同金属的无形混合物到类人和野兽般的怪物。

金属躯体 Metal Forms

尽管金属元素生物几乎完全由金属构成，但它们大多由微小的不同金属层组成，复杂如肉体或植物组织。这些金属中的许多都因金属位面的自然缓慢熵增而生锈或腐朽。

奇异的金属 Strange Metals

虚铅（Inubrix）和山铜是天金的类型——在宇宙中用来指代极为罕见的金属的统称，大多数具有魔法属性，来源于遥远的星球和陨落的星星。天金在金位面上很丰富，并且多金元素生物至少含有一种或另一种天金。虚铅，俗称幽灵铁（ghost iron），因其能穿透其他金属而受到珍视，而山铜的神秘性质可以扭曲其周围的时间流。

Phase Blade.name: 相位刀刃 Phase Blade
Phase Blade.description: 天金打击者的虚铅尖牙打击会忽略金属护甲的护甲专精效果所带来的伤害抗力，并且忽视金属盾牌提供的对AC提供的环境加值，同时不会触发借由金属盾牌做出的盾牌格挡反应动作。

Temporal Stutter.name: 时间波动 Temporal Stutter
Temporal Stutter.description:
一个尚未受到时间波动影响的生物，在受到天金打击者的山铜尖牙打击造成的伤害时，必须尝试@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]豁免。

大成功 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened 2}，直到他的下个回合结束。

成功 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened 1}，直到他的下个回合结束。

失败 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，直到他的下个回合结束。

大失败 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}，直到他的下个回合结束。

Two-Headed Assault.name: 双头突击 Two-Headed Assault
Two-Headed Assault.description: 天金打击者进行一次虚铅尖牙和一次山铜尖牙打击，每次针对不同的目标。它的多重攻击减值在两次攻击完成后才增加。

Vault Builder.name: 造窟者 Vault Builder
Vault Builder.publicNotes:
造窟者仍然拥有莎莱祖尔灌输给他们的全部力量，能够创造新生命，塑造其周围的世界。造窟者的寿命为几千年，但他们的记忆会被保存在一块水晶传承石中，在他们死后会将之放进一具新构造的造窟者身躯中。
